monogr.author: Thomas Jefferson Whitman
monogr.title: Dear Brother Walt: The Letters of Thomas Jefferson Whitman

bibl.author: Thomas Jefferson Whitman
bibl.title: Thomas Jefferson Whitman to Walt Whitman, 14 July 1888
bibl.orgName: Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: I was very very glad to get a letter from you yesterday. I have been quite worried about you, wondering how things were going I am more than glad to hear that you are holding your own

I am up here on a question of the disposal of the sewage of the city Davis and Flad are associated with me and we have been confabing about a week—Yesterday they went away—leaving me here to make surveys etc
I am going down to Chicago in the morning to meet some people—will be back here on Wednesday
I hope dear Walt that you are gaining again—I was very sorry that I could not get back to Camden—but I had to go with my Committee to Louisville
